result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca A. Farrar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misdemeanor Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rebecca A. Farrar

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

Case called at 11:13 AM. Hearing held via Zoom and in person.
Defendant Rebecca A. Farrar appeared by phone.  Attorney Erika Amundson in court for Rebecca A. Farrar.  Attorney Robert Stoiber appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Agreement has been reached. Defendant waives her right to personal appearance. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Count 1 is amended to Misdemeanor Retail Theft.  Defendant pleads No Contest. Restitution in the amount of $84.55 was paid up front.
Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty and sentences her to Court Costs/surcharges, Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.

The Court Orders: Rebecca Farrar may appear remotely for the proceeding scheduled on 09/06/2022 at 11:30 a.m.

Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 
Case is referred to branch 2 to schedule ARGN.
